lectures.notes: This lecture introduces Node.js, a JavaScript runtime environment, exploring its core concepts, features, and how it enables server-side JavaScript development.
lectures.title: What is Node.js?

lectures.notes: Learn how to install Node.js on your system, including step-by-step instructions for different operating systems and setting up your development environment.
lectures.title: Node.js Installation

lectures.notes: Get started with Node.js by writing your first simple program, a classic "Hello World" example, to understand the basics of creating and running Node.js applications.
lectures.title: Hello World Node.js

lectures.notes: Explore the concept of modules in Node.js, understanding how they break down code into reusable components, manage dependencies, and enhance code organization.
lectures.title: Modules in Node.js

lectures.notes: Discover how to work with files in Node.js, covering essential file system operations like reading, writing, creating, and deleting files, along with error handling.
lectures.title: File Handling in Node.js

lectures.notes: Gain insights into how Node.js works behind the scenes, exploring its event loop mechanism, asynchronous programming, and the non-blocking I/O model that makes it efficient.
lectures.title: How Node.js Works?

lectures.notes: Learn how to build basic HTTP servers in Node.js, understanding the fundamental concepts of HTTP requests and responses, and creating web servers that can handle client connections.
lectures.title: Building HTTP Server in Node.js

lectures.notes: Explore different techniques for handling URLs in Node.js, including parsing URL components, routing requests based on paths, and creating dynamic web applications.
lectures.title: Handling URL's in Node.js

lectures.notes: Understand the different HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.), how they are used in web development, and how to implement them in your Node.js applications.
lectures.title: HTTP METHODS

lectures.notes: Get started with Express.js, a popular framework for Node.js, learning about its core features, routing, middleware, and how it simplifies building web applications.
lectures.title: Getting Started with Express and Node.js

lectures.notes: Explore how versioning works in Node.js, understanding semantic versioning conventions, managing dependencies across projects, and handling compatibility issues.
lectures.title: How Versioning Works in Node.js?

lectures.notes: Learn about REST APIs, their architectural principles, and how they facilitate communication between different systems through a standardized interface.
lectures.title: What is REST API?

lectures.notes: Build RESTful APIs using Node.js and Express.js, covering routing, request handling, data manipulation, and creating robust web services.
lectures.title: Building REST API's using Node and Express.js

lectures.notes: Get introduced to Postman, a powerful tool for testing and interacting with REST APIs, exploring its features for sending requests, inspecting responses, and managing API documentation.
lectures.title: Introduction to POSTMAN for REST API's

lectures.notes: Understand the concept of middleware in Express.js, how it intercepts requests and responses, and how it can be used for authentication, logging, and other common tasks.
lectures.title: Express Middleware

lectures.notes: Explore HTTP headers in API contexts, understanding their role in communication, common header types, and how they can be used for authentication, content negotiation, and other purposes.
lectures.title: What are HTTP Headers in API

lectures.notes: Learn about HTTP status codes, understanding their meanings, how they are used to indicate the outcome of API requests, and how they help developers handle responses effectively.
lectures.title: HTTP Status Codes

lectures.notes: Get started with MongoDB, a popular NoSQL database, understanding its key concepts, document-oriented structure, and how it differs from relational databases.
lectures.title: Getting Started with MongoDB

lectures.notes: Learn how to connect Node.js applications to MongoDB databases using Mongoose, a powerful ODM (Object Document Mapper), enabling seamless interactions with the database.
lectures.title: Connecting NodeJS with MongoDB | Mongoose + Express

lectures.notes: Understand the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern, its benefits for structuring applications, and how to implement it effectively in Node.js projects.
lectures.title: Model View Controller in NodeJS | MVC Pattern

lectures.notes: Build a custom URL shortener application using Node.js and MongoDB, learning about database design, URL manipulation, and implementing a real-world application.
lectures.title: Create a Custom URL Shortener using Node.JS and MongoDB

lectures.notes: Explore Server-Side Rendering (SSR) with EJS and Node.js, understanding how to generate HTML on the server, improve SEO, and enhance user experience.
lectures.title: Server Side Rendering with EJS and Node.JS

lectures.notes: Implement secure authentication mechanisms for your Node.js applications from scratch, covering user registration, login, password hashing, and session management.
lectures.title: Building Node.js Authentication from Scratch

lectures.notes: Learn about JWT (JSON Web Token) authentication, understanding its principles, how it works, and how to implement secure JWT-based authentication in Node.js applications.
lectures.title: JWT Authentication in NodeJS

lectures.notes: Explore cookies in Node.js, understanding their purpose, how they are used for session management, and how to handle cookies securely in web applications.
lectures.title: What are Cookies in NodeJS?

lectures.notes: Understand the concept of authorization in Node.js, learning how to control access to resources based on user roles, permissions, and other factors.
lectures.title: Authorization in NodeJS

lectures.notes: Create a Discord bot using Node.js, exploring the Discord API, event handling, command processing, and how to interact with the Discord platform.
lectures.title: Creating Discord Bot in NodeJS

lectures.notes: Learn how to upload files in Node.js applications using Multer, a popular middleware for handling file uploads, covering file storage, validation, and error handling.
lectures.title: Uploading Files with NodeJS and Multer

lectures.notes: Set up the foundation for a Node.js blogging application with MongoDB, including database schema design, user models, and basic post creation functionality.
lectures.title: Setting Up Project - NodeJS Blogging Application with MongoDB

lectures.notes: Implement authentication for your Node.js blogging application using MongoDB, securing user accounts, managing logins, and ensuring data privacy.
lectures.title: Setting up Authentication  - NodeJS Blogging Application with MongoDB

lectures.notes: Complete the development of a full-featured Node.js blogging application, integrating MongoDB for data persistence and EJS for templating.
lectures.title: Complete Blog App - NodeJS, MongoDB and EJS

lectures.notes: Deploy your Node.js application to Amazon Web Services (AWS), understanding the benefits of cloud deployment, configuring AWS infrastructure, and deploying your application.
lectures.title: Deploy NodeJS Application on AWS - Amazon Web Services | NodeJS

lectures.notes: Explore WebSocket communication in Node.js using Socket.IO, enabling real-time messaging and interactive applications, understanding the benefits of WebSocket over HTTP.
lectures.title: WebSocket in NodeJS | Socket.IO - Real Time Messaging

lectures.notes: Learn about Node.js streams, understanding their purpose, how they enable efficient data processing, and how to use them for file handling, network communication, and other tasks.
lectures.title: NodeJS Streams

lectures.notes: Discover how to scale Node.js applications using the cluster module, leveraging multi-core processors to improve performance and handle large workloads.
lectures.title: How to scale NodeJs applications using the cluster module.

lectures.notes: Get introduced to Nginx, a powerful web server and reverse proxy, understanding its capabilities for load balancing, caching, and enhancing web application performance.
lectures.title: What is Nginx?

lectures.notes: Learn how to install and configure Nginx on your system, setting up the web server and configuring its basic settings for serving web content.
lectures.title: Install and Setup Nginx

lectures.notes: Understand how to serve static content using Nginx, configure file serving rules, and optimize web server performance for delivering static files efficiently.
lectures.title: Serve Static Content with Nginx

lectures.notes: Explore a complete deployment workflow for Node.js applications using Nginx as a reverse proxy, setting up SSL with Let's Encrypt for secure communication.
lectures.title: Full Node.js Deployment - NGINX, SSL With Lets Encrypt

lectures.notes: Learn about the Serverless framework and its benefits for building and deploying serverless applications using Node.js, understanding the advantages of serverless architecture.
lectures.title: Serverless Framework with NodeJS

lectures.notes: Explore the concept of serverless computing, comparing serverless and monolithic architectures, and understanding how AWS Lambda works as a serverless platform.
lectures.title: What is Serverless? | Serverless Vs Monolith | AWS Lambda

lectures.notes: Dive into GraphQL, a query language for APIs, understanding its benefits over REST APIs, learning about schema definition, query syntax, and resolving data.
lectures.title: GraphQL Crash Course - GraphQL NodeJS

lectures.notes: Build the backend architecture for a Threads application clone using GraphQL, designing the schema, defining resolvers, and implementing core functionality.
lectures.title: Threads App GraphQL Clone | Backend Architecture

lectures.notes: Set up a GraphQL server using Node.js, including installation, schema definition, and connecting to a database, exploring different GraphQL libraries and tools.
lectures.title: Setting up Graphql Server | Complete GraphQL Series

lectures.notes: Learn how to integrate Prisma with a PostgreSQL database in your GraphQL server, leveraging its ORM (Object Relational Mapper) for database interactions.
lectures.title: Graphql Prisma Postgresql Setup | Complete GraphQL Series

lectures.notes: Refactor your GraphQL code for better organization and maintainability, applying best practices, using directives, and optimizing for performance.
lectures.title: Refactoring GraphQL Code | Complete GraphQL Series

lectures.notes: Implement authentication in your GraphQL server, securing endpoints, managing user sessions, and verifying user credentials.
lectures.title: Authentication with GraphQL Server | Complete GraphQL Series

lectures.notes: Explore JWT authentication within the context of GraphQL, understanding how to integrate JWTs into your schema, create a secure context, and manage user data.
lectures.title: JWT Authentication and Context in GraphQL

course.name: Mastering Node.js
course.overview: This comprehensive course will guide you through the fundamentals of Node.js, teaching you how to build server-side applications, REST APIs, and explore advanced concepts like authentication, websockets, and serverless deployments.
